The Sales and Events Manager at Eddie V's is accountable for delivering profitable sales growth by creating and executing business development plans to acquire new guests and growing contracted dining business by creating indulgent experiences for our guests. Core tenets of the role include building relationships with new and existing guests, growing total revenue and contracted dining revenue, and executing over-the-top contracted event dining experiences for our guests. Successful performance is measured by consistent delivery of profitable sales growth through our systems and procedures from the perspective of all our stakeholders.

Reports To: Managing Partner

Direct Reports: 1 - 8

Responsibilities
Create accountability for profitable sales growth results
Achieve restaurant financial goals, including but not limited to overall sales growth, close ratios, and private dining sales
Manage and reconcile the local marketing budget to generate a positive return on investment (ROI) on sales initiatives
Strategize with managing partner to identify specific business needs and implement sales plans to address gaps, such as:
Host in-house or off-site events to source new business (meeting planners, administrative assistants, etc.)
Introduce new and reintroduce lapsed guests to the restaurant by leveraging local marketing funds
Provide insight into sales projections on a weekly basis and develop outreach and in-reach plans to meet sales targets
Execute sales outreach plans for national and local events (e.g. Restaurant Week, gift cards sales, wine events) as prescribed
(e.g. send invitations to organizations; create team contests; garner referrals; and reengage past guests)
Cultivate guest relationships
Buid track customer relationship management (CRM) outreach to prospects and existing guests
Source new business by developing referral relationships with partner organizations (chambers, CVB, hotels, etc.)
Grow guest database for actionable outreach (birthday, anniversary, email marketing) by ensuring guest and reservation information database is accurately recorded and cleansed weekly
Develop and foster a strong sales culture by educating and coaching team members on relationship building and sales growth
Grow contracted dining business by creating indulgent experiences
Source, develop, and grow relationships with key stakeholders at nearby businesses (e.g. admins, meeting planners, etc.)
Negotiate contracts, accurately record event details in the group sales software and reservation system, and communicate/deliver event orders to managers, culinary and service team members to create indulgent event experiences for our guests
Create accountability for flawlessly planning and executing all contracted dining events o Greet, be present and be of service to event hosts to ensure their expectations are exceeded (typically remain in the restaurant until main course is served)
Follow up with private dining guests after their events to gauge feedback, be of service and secure repeat business
Other responsibilities
Leverage Host University to improve sales acumen amongst sales professionals and hosts o Participate in regularly scheduled training sessions to continually learn and share best practices and develop new sales skills
Support the managing partner with ensuring reservation system is optimized
Ensure all communications from Restaurant Support Center (RSC) are disseminated and implemented on time
Partner with RSC for legal and financial counsel, as well as approvals on published marketing materials and partnerships
Secure approvals and use the project management system to create marketing collateral to support sales initiatives

Education, Training, Experience and Key Qualifications
Proficient verbal and written English communication required
Experience in luxury brands or high-touch service culture preferred
Bachelor's degree (Hospitality, Business) preferred
Proficiency with Outlook, OpenTable and Gather preferred

Location: Princeton, NJ (08540)
Type: Contract
Rate: $65 per hour

Position Summary
The OnBase System Administrator is responsible for the administration and support of the University’s OnBase platform and associated services. This position requires maintaining proper configuration and access controls as well as supporting business solutions in the areas of document management, workflow, imaging, and integration with business applications. In addition, this position is responsible for monitoring new trends in technology that will impact the OnBase platform and lead strategic technology projects to further the continual improvement of OIT provided services.
Responsibilities
Platform Administration (40%):
Leads the administration and maintenance activities for the University's OnBase platform which includes installing new software releases and system upgrades, evaluating and installing patches, and conducting application/configuration migrations, refreshes, and restores.
Collaborates with infrastructure providers to determine requirements for the deployment of database, web, and application servers in a multi-instance environment.
Specifies and verifies the architecture necessary for OnBase integration with other application systems.
Customer Support/Problem Resolution (30%):
Lead Ongoing Architectural Strategy (10%):
Vendor Management (20%):
Essential Qualifications
3-5 years of experience as an application administrator using Windows/IIS with a minimum of 2 year/s experience as an OnBase administrator.
Extensive Experience with the installation, upgrade, enhancement, and support of large-scale and varied administrative applications including Hyland’s OnBase ECM software.
Ability to develop and maintain a comprehensive understanding of OnBase administration tasks including security, roles, users, managing errors and installation.
Ability to triage, troubleshoot, and resolve OnBase issues reported by users, understanding and supporting processes and OnBase applications across multiple business areas.
Ability to maintain proper configuration and access control across environments.
OnBase Certified System Administrator (OCSA).
OnBase Certified Workflow Administrator (OCWA).
Experience with implementing/troubleshooting IIS and Windows server 2008/2012.
Highly motivated and self-directed with strong interpersonal and oral/written communication skills.
Ability to prioritize and multi-task between projects and applications.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experience working in and contributing to a team-oriented, collaborative environment that values positive, collegial relationships among co-workers.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with OnBase Workflow Studio Export, Utils Import/Export Configuration, and Configuration Migration.
SQL Scripting, PL/SQL.
Experience with Oracle 11 and MS SQL server 2005 database or higher.
Experience in a higher education setting.
Experience with Service Now.
Knowledge of and experience with BizTalk integration for OnBase.
Experience with OnBase API, C#, VBScript, and/or PowerShell scripting.

Description:
Thank you for your interest in working at William Paterson University.

William Paterson University invites applications for the positon of Adjunct Faculty within the College of Science and Health, Department of Computer Science.

Thank you for expressing interest in serving as an adjunct faculty member at William Paterson University.

Please note that there may not be a vacancy at this time. Rather, qualified applicants may be contacted if and when there is an immediate need, or on an exploratory basis for a future opening. For general questions, please email talent@wpunj.edu

Undergraduate courses in this department are taught both online and in person.

Those generally taught by Adjunct faculty include, but are not limited to:

• Computer and Information Technology

• Applied Operating Systems

• Discrete Structures for CIT

• Fundamentals of Computer Networking

• System Administration

• Data Management Concepts and Applications Creditsy

• Cloud Computing

Department Overview:

The Department of Computer Science provides the opportunity for students to attain BS degrees in Computer Science and Information Technology . We aim to educate and inspire our graduates to develop hardware and software, integrate them into computer systems and networks, and monitor, maintain, and enhance those systems. We equip them to successfully launch rewarding careers in mainstream computing industries as software engineers, data analysts, business analysts, programmers, system analysts, database administrators, test engineers, network specialists, or computer scientists. Some pursue graduate studies at prominent regional and national universities. Our programs of study enable students to develop strong communication, teamwork, and technology skills in a highly collaborative learning environment.

For more information about the department, please visit https://cs-cit.wpunj.edu/cs/index.html

Duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

• Using the course outline as a guide, develop relevant syllabi in order to deploy course content, objectives, and methods of student assessment for up to six (6) credits per semester in an undergraduate course (see course listing above).

• Contribute to student success by providing consistent and effective support and guidance through role modeling and mentoring and being available to the students for their questions and needs.

• Teach in person and/or online depending upon course schedules and department needs.

Required Qualifications for Undergraduate courses:

• Masters in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related areas.

• Some experience either in computing or the associated information technologies as a professional.

• Full time or part-time employment or active professional practice.

• Ability to teach online and in person.

Preferred Qualifications:

• Professional certification and/or continuing professional education relevant to business domain.

• Professional activity within discipline such as relevant-to-teaching area leadership or managerial role in a business enterprise, non-profit organization or government agency or business professional organization or society.

• Experience teaching both online and in person.

Title:
Sr. Production Support Lead / Warren, NJ (HQ)

Company:
Everest Global Services, Inc.

Job Category:
Technology

Job Description:

Everest is a leading global reinsurance and insurance provider, operating for nearly 50 years through subsidiaries in the Europe, Bermuda, Canada, Singapore, US, and other territories. Our strengths include extensive product and distribution capabilities, a strong balance sheet, and an innovative culture. Throughout our history, Everest has maintained its discipline and focuses on creating long-term value through underwriting excellence and strong risk and capital management. But the most critical asset in this organization is our people.

Everest is a growth company offering Property, Casualty, and specialty products among others, through its various operating subsidiaries located in key markets around the world. Everest has been a global leader in reinsurance with a broad footprint, deep client relationships, underwriting excellence, responsive service, and customized solutions. Our insurance arm draws upon impressive global resources and financial strength to tailor each policy to meet the individual needs of our customers.

We take pride in being known in the industry as nimble, entrepreneurial, and responsive. Our culture is innovative, we empower our employees to make business decisions within our risk framework at a local level.

At Everest, we are committed to the development of our people. We offer dynamic training & professional development to our employees. You will benefit from career development and learning opportunities that will let you set career goals and fulfill them, including:

• Generous tuition/continuing education reimbursement

• Mentoring opportunities

• Flexible work arrangements

• Talent development initiatives

• Networking groups

Job Details:

In order to support Everest's expansion, we are seeking a Senior Production Support Lead to join our growing Global Production Operations team. This role will be supporting our Insurance Application portfolio. You will be helping understand the changing needs of the application users by managing production ticket resolution, prioritizing production fixes, documenting changes, supporting the application usage, and working with team and business leadership for key metric reporting.

Responsibilities:
Lead incident management and provide support to teams for triaging the issue.
Liaison between technology and the business community including outsourced vendors
Oversee root cause efforts for production defects working with cross functional and technical teams.
Interact with infrastructure, release management, change management, QA, DBA and application teams.
Provide regular status reports to management on application status and other metrics.
Coordinate escalation and resolution of major service issues.
Report promptly to management and business partners regarding critical outages until resolution
Manage off-shore, outsourced vendor to an SLA and execution of critical situations
Coordinate areas of communication within firm having impact on scope, budget, risk and resources
SLA Management, Metrics / KPI development to drive a higher degree of customer satisfaction.
Report on status of development and quality to management.
Capacity Planning/Forecasting
Hands-On management of L3 escalations


Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in computer science or related technical discipline.
10+ years of experience in Business logic and application flow Production/Application Support, preferably .net
5+ years Interacting with business stakeholders on defining and supporting applications.
5+ years acting in a management or lead capacity.
Deep knowledge of Insurance business
Experience Supporting Cloud Platforms - Azure preferred.
Knowledge of Agile Methodology, SCRUM framework, SDLC, CI/CD, DevOps
Experience supporting large-scale distributed systems
Deployment tools like Repliweb, HP DMA, Jenkins, UDeploy & Ansible.
Knowledge of Prod/Contingency patching process for supporting them during patch cycle
Knowledge of ITIL framework including ITSM - Incident, Change and Problem management.

Description

Description

At Vydia, our mission is to empower music businesses and entrepreneurs that support artists with our robust suite of services (including monetization, distribution, and analytics) powered by our cutting-edge technology. We are proud partners with music industry leaders such as Spotify, Apple Music, YouTube, Tidal, TikTok and more, to deliver our clients' content onto their platforms with ease, priority, and reliability.

The Impact You Will Make

Vydia is seeking an experienced Product Manager who has a reputation for delivering innovative, high quality products to join our team. Our next Product Manager will have the opportunity to work with both internal and external stakeholders to identify needs and add value across our core product offerings, including partner integrations, internal operations tools, and user-facing features.

In addition to internal stakeholders, you will have the exciting opportunity to work with our music distribution partners (Apple Music, Spotify, Amazon Music, YouTube, Facebook, etc.) and help keep those relationships strong by integrating new features and keeping our platform in compliance with their evolving requirements. You will also interface with clients to understand their needs and translate them into software solutions.

You will be joining a small but growing team, and will have the opportunity to directly impact and influence various high impact initiatives for the company. You will work alongside fellow product managers, engineers, and designers to deliver amazing features and products to both our internal stakeholders and external clients.

This position requires an intricately organized, self-motivated expert to support cross-team functionality with an entrepreneurial spirit. You will need impeccable communication skills as you will be working with many sectors of the business. The position is dynamic and requires flexibility as much as it requires discipline and attention to detail.

This full time hybrid position reports to the Vice President of Product Management and will require the employee to come to our Holmdel, NJ office several times each month (minimally 2-3x per month).

What You Will Do:
Understand Vydia's strategic and competitive position in order to leverage stakeholder insights, market analysis, and business objectives when establishing market need
Analyze and anticipate customers' needs through both user data and direct communication.
Lead teams of developers, data engineers, and designers to translate business opportunities into software solutions and deliver amazing products to our clients and internal teams
Work with the PM team to prioritize the Product backlog and inform the roadmap based on feedback from Stakeholders, customers, and up-to-date analysis of market conditions to align with business goals.
Take ownership of the product backlog, fielding feature requests, writing user stories, sourcing wireframes/prototypes, and defining acceptance criteria.
Verify User Acceptance Testing to ensure functionality requested is delivered as expected
Communicate with customer facing teams on updates and help create a process for Beta testing and delivering features to users.
Liaise with marketing to determine effective go-to-market strategies for product launches both internally and externally
Analyze data in order to set benchmarks and measure the success of features.
Attend cross-functional sprint meetings with the product organization including Daily PM Stand Up, Sprint Planning, Sprint Review and Sprint Retrospective.
Maximize the value and efficiency of the product team, operating in an agile environment

What We Are Looking For:
A growth-minded team player who is focused on outcomes
Outstanding organizational, communication, and analytical skills
Strong understanding of agile software development
Understanding of Product or Project management software (Jira, Productboard)
Experience working with data analytics
2+ years software product management, product design, or IT project management experience (preferably in the video, media, or music space)
2+ years experience managing user interfaces, wireframes, and mockups

Nice to Haves:
Exceptional understanding and passion for the Music/Entertainment industry
General understanding of video & audio monetization and IP-protection technology
Experience working with database architecture, financial products, or internal admin products
Experience working with music distribution service providers
MBA

Reasons to work with us:
Vydia is certified as a Great Place to Work™ company and has been named Best Place to Work in NJ by NJBIZ 6x (2024 most recent) due to its collaborative, fast-paced, fun, thriving environment. Additionally, Vydia has been named a 2023 Fortune Best Workplaces in New York.
Vydia was honored with the 2023 TechUnited Catalyst of Technology Award for our cutting-edge technology and scalable platform that provides global music entrepreneurs and their labels the ability to stay independent. Vydia was also named the 2022 winner of the NJBIZ Business Of The Year award (51-100 employees) which recognizes the state's most dynamic businesses and business leaders who share a commitment to professional excellence, business growth, and the community.
Major growth opportunities alongside the growth of the company; Vydia has been identified as an Inc 500 Fastest Growing Company in America and by Entrepreneur Magazine as one of the most Entrepreneurial companies in America
Join a mission-based culture that enjoys giving back to the community through a variety of initiatives that are meaningful to our team members
Full medical/dental/vision package, 401k retirement with employer matching, and financial wellness plans
We invest in your growth and development, providing a professional development stipend for continued education and mentorship to support your career goals
Hybrid/Remote flexibility to work from home
Generous vacation policy including paid parental leave
Vydia provides equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees and strictly prohibits any type of harassment or discrimination in regard to race, religion, age, color, sex, disability status, national origin, genetics, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, gender expression, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, and/or local laws.
Consistent with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), it is the policy of Vydia to provide reasonable accommodation when requested by a qualified applicant or employee with a disability, unless such accommodation would cause an undue hardship. The policy regarding requests for reasonable accommodation applies to all aspects of employment, including the application process. If reasonable accommodation is needed, please contact HR@Vydia.com
Your employment with Vydia is on an at-will basis, meaning either you or the Company can terminate the employment relationship, at any time, for any or no reason, and with or without cause or notice. As an at-will employee, your employment with Vydia is not guaranteed for any length of time.

About Vydia:

Vydia is an end-to-end music technology platform and services company that provides labels with the infrastructure and tools to power their business. The company's innovative solutions in rights management, automated royalty accounting, advanced payments, and daily performance analytics provide leaders in music and culture with the unfettered ability to publish, distribute, and monetize their audio-visual content on a global scale. Vydia is a wholly-owned division of gamma., the artist-first multimedia platform providing creative and business services across all artistic and commercial formats founded by CEO Larry Jackson and President Ike Youssef. To learn more, please visit vydia.com

admins, meeting planners, etc.) Negotiate contracts, accurately record event details in the group sales software and reservation system, and communicate/deliver event orders to managers, culinary and service team members to create indulgent event experiences for our guests Create accountability for flawlessly planning and executing all contracted dining events o Greet, be present and be of service to event hosts to ensure their expectations are exceeded (typically remain in the restaurant until main course is served) Follow up with private dining guests after their events to gauge feedback, be of service and secure repeat business Other responsibilities Leverage Host University to improve sales acumen amongst sales professionals and hosts o Participate in regularly scheduled training sessions to continually learn and share best practices and develop new sales skills Support the managing partner with ensuring reservation system is optimized Ensure all communications from Restaurant Support Center (RSC) are disseminated and implemented on time Partner with RSC for legal and financial counsel, as well as approvals on published marketing materials and partnerships Secure approvals and use the project management system to create marketing collateral to support sales initiatives Education, Training, Experience and Key Qualifications Proficient verbal and written English communication required Experience in luxury brands or high-touch service culture preferred Bachelor's degree (Hospitality, Business) preferred Proficiency with Outlook, OpenTable and Gather preferred Apply

At BrightView, the best teams are created and maintained here. If you are searching for your next fulfilling career, picture yourself on a best-in-class team where you can grow to be your brightest. We're looking for an Account Manager. Can you picture yourself here?

Here's what you'd do:

You'd be the primary contact for your clients, building long-term relationships that foster satisfaction, retention, and ancillary sales. You'd also oversee field operations and supervise a Production Manager, who works with the crew to deliver fantastic service in the field.

You'd be responsible for:
Client Satisfaction:
Developing and maintaining long-term relationships with clients
Performing site walkthroughs with clients to ensure quality and service expectations are met
Facilitating the resolution of client concerns to ensure renewal
Sales:
Proactively presenting site enhancement ideas to your clients
Generating referrals from existing clients and passing them to the Business Developer
Developing accurate estimates for new and existing clients, maintaining acceptable gross margins that support the branch's financial goals
Operations:
Assisting in overall leadership of the branch
Maintaining satisfactory accounts receivable levels
Coordinating with the Branch Administrator to ensure branch databases contain up-to-date client information

1 year minimum of supervisory experience in the landscape or service industry
An associate's degree in a business-related field or equivalent experience

The ability to coach and develop teams

Description:
Position Summary
Responsible for designing, conducting and organizing training programs to improve employee performance and ensure organizational productivity. Will analyze training needs and recommend appropriate development strategy(s).
Essential Functions
Assess training needs through consultation with managers, interviews with employees, focus groups, or surveys to develop new programs or modify and improve existing programs to meet emerging organizational or individual trends, needs or skill gaps.
Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs using knowledge of effective adult learning methods such as classroom training, seminars, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops. Select and use training/instructional methods and procedures appropriate for the situation and audience.
Offer specific training programs to help workers maintain or improve job skills.
Develop or obtain training manuals, guides, course materials, handouts, and multimedia visual aids.
Evaluate training materials such as textbooks and handouts to ensure that material being presented to employees is appropriate to the audience, relevant and aligned with needs assessment and skills gap analysis for the employee and the organization.
Conduct or arrange for the delivery of ongoing technical and skills training and personal development classes for managers and staff. Present information to trainees using a variety of instructional techniques or formats, such as role playing, simulations, team exercises, group discussions, videos, or lectures.
Train managers and supervisors in techniques and skills for coaching and developing employees.
Monitor training costs to ensure budget is not exceeded; prepare cost/benefit analysis to justify training expenditures.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures for skills and technical training programs.
Build and maintain organization-wide training database; create management reports as requested.
Create and maintain an annual training calendar based upon needs analysis; adjustment the calendar as attendance and emerging needs dictate.
Administer annual compliance assignments for all employees.
Deliver monthly HR Orientation sessions.
Additional Functions
Research training requests for external training course or educational opportunities.
Keeping up-to-date technically and apply new knowledge in the field of adult and lifetime learning.
Job Requirements and Qualifications
Travel to branch locations and training center is required.
Education and Experience
Bachelor's degree in education, organizational development, business, or similar field.
Minimum 4 years' experience in a trainer/training manager capacity.
Minimum 5 years' experience in banking industry preferred.
Licenses and Certifications
N/A
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Excellent computer skills in a Microsoft Windows environment including proficiency in Word and Excel.
Excellent at talking to others to convey information effectively; teaching others how to do something.
Excellent active listening skills-giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.
Excellent use of logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.
Skilled in adjusting actions in relation to others' actions and needs.
Knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar.
Knowledge of principles and methods for curriculum and training design, teaching and instruction for adult learners and groups, and the measurement of training effects.
Knowledge of human behavior and performance; individual differences in ability, personality, and interests; group behavior and dynamics; and learning and motivation.
Knowledge of media production, communication, and dissemination techniques and methods. This includes alternative ways to inform and entertain via written, oral, and visual media.
Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer and personal services. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.
Knowledge of administrative and clerical procedures and systems such as word processing, managing files and records, designing forms, and other office procedures and terminology.
Ability to come up with a number of ideas about a topic and to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions. Ability to quickly make sense of, combine, and organize information into meaningful contexts.
Ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking and writing so others will understand.
Ability to translate wheat information means and how it can be used.
Ability to work independently with little supervision.
Physical Requirements
Ability to sit for long periods of time up to 75% of work hours.
Ability to use hands to grasp, handle and operate office, computer and audio-visual equipment.
Ability to stand for long periods of time up to 50% of work hours.
Ability to talk, listen and see.
Ability to lift up to 20 lbs. at least 25% of work hours.
Working Conditions
Moderate sound as in business office with office machines, computers, and people traffic.

Fluency in the Elite 3E SQL database schema preferred or a demonstrated ability to develop such fluency based on experience with other systems.
Experience with any of Elite 3E Templates ("Design Gallery”), Workspace, BizTalk, Elite Application Framework and Tools, or 3E Solutions Manager is a plus and would be very attractive.
Proficiency in XML/XSLT transformation.
Proficiency in PowerShell, C#, Visual Basic .Net, HTML5, and other programming or scripting languages.
Experience administering Windows Server.
This person will work closely with the Enterprise Applications Manager in IT, Accounting, Marketing, Records, and other firm personnel to ensure all applications run optimally and without interruption.
Good communication and technical and analytical skills are required, focusing heavily on Microsoft SQL (querying, reporting in SSIS and other tools, maintenance, documentation, and upgrades), Windows Servers, and Microsoft online services.
Some programming knowledge would be a 'nice to have,' but expert knowledge is not required.

Essential Job Functions and Responsibilities:
As part of the team, integrate, update, administer, and support the firm's management applications, which include the following:
Finance: Elite 3E, Intapp (Time, Risk, Intake), Concur, Iridium reporting and analytics
Practice-specific tools: Aderant CompuLaw
Marketing: Foundations
Job Description:
Performing application implementations, reconfiguration, upgrades, and periodic maintenance.
Administering the underlying platforms, especially Microsoft SQL, SSRS, SSIS, Active Directory and Azure AD authentication and integration, and Windows Servers.
Coordinating with other departments and stakeholders during projects and system upgrades; assessing and communicating risk factors, primarily when integrated systems cause a "trickle-down” effect.
Participating in month-end maintenance such as Windows updates, SQL maintenance, query optimization, and security patching.
Testing applications during system changes, enhancements, upgrades, and monthly maintenance.
Documenting system configurations, integrations, backup, disaster recovery, and other processes.
Created how-to guides and documented resolutions to frequently asked questions.
Communicating and informing the department and management of project statuses, issues, and proposed resolutions.
Resolving support requests/tickets escalated from the helpdesk team, including 'end user' application troubleshooting.
Managing vendor support tickets.
Tracking and optimizing system performance and storage utilization and planning for necessary hardware or software upgrades to support system growth.
Researching and evaluating new tools/technologies to improve the current application stack.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Proficiency in SQL administration, data queries, and reporting ("SSRS”) essential
Demonstrated ability to learn functional and technical integration aspects of the firm's applications based on experience in various environments.
3+ years' experience operating accounting, time tracking, billing, and management software in a legal or other professional services company strongly preferred.
Fluency in the Elite 3E SQL database schema preferred or a demonstrated ability to develop such fluency based on experience with other systems.
Experience with any of Elite 3E Templates ("Design Gallery”), Workspace, BizTalk, Elite Application Framework and Tools, or 3E Solutions Manager is a plus and would be very attractive.
Proficiency in XML/XSLT transformation.
Proficiency in PowerShell, C#, Visual Basic .Net, HTML5, and other programming or scripting languages.
Experience administering Windows Server.
Solid technical foundation with the ability to troubleshoot, diagnose, and resolve complex problems and implement solutions with minimal guidance.
Self-motivated with excellent time management skills.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to communicate results.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to communicate with staff of varying technical expertise.
Non-essential Functions:
Responsible for communication, coordination, and "backup” of other members of the Information Technology Department as required to service the firm and its clients.
Exempt position: expected to work additional hours, weekends, and holidays, as required to perform customary and typical IT duties.
This position is considered essential to the firm's function. Therefore, attendance during firm administrative leave and closings may be required.
Support and monitor firm policies and procedures as pertain to the Information Technology Department.

Education and/or Experience:
Minimum 3 years experience in management, design, and implementation of large enterprise applications in a heterogeneous operating system environment with hands-on experience in maintaining mission-critical enterprise applications at a high level of availability.
Broad knowledge of the specialized and technical field of computer science and business/management acumen equivalent to a complete college or university education; includes thorough skills knowledge.
4-year college degree preferred; equivalent experience considered.
Certificates, Licenses, Registrations:
Microsoft and other vendor certifications are preferred but not required.

Investment Management - Investment Operations

A GLOBAL FIRM WITH A DIVERSE & INCLUSIVE CULTURE

As the Global Asset Management business of Prudential, we're always looking for ways to improve financial services. We're passionate about making a meaningful impact - touching the lives of millions and solving financial challenges in an ever-changing world.

We also believe talent is key to achieving our vision and are intentional about building a culture on respect and collaboration. When you join PGIM, you'll unlock a motivating and impactful career - all while growing your skills and advancing your profession at one of the world's leading global asset managers!

If you're not afraid to think differently and challenge the status quo, come and be a part of a dedicated team that's investing in your future by shaping tomorrow today.

At PGIM, You Can!

What you will do

PGIM Fixed Income is seeking an Associate Manager, Alternative Operations Specialist who will be primarily responsible for providing regulatory and tax support functions for the organization and to serve as one of the primary points of contact for internal and external business partners. Additional Operations and Accounting/Administrator support work may be required.

What you can expect
Assist in the facilitation of quarterly and annual SEC and NFA regulatory filings, including Form PF, CPO-PQR and Form ADV (where applicable)
Well-versed in Private Fund regulatory reporting requirements, including: Hedge Funds, Private Equity Funds, Liquidity Funds, and Other Private Funds
Familiar with AIF/AIFM and other EMEA regulatory reporting requirements, including Annex IV
Point of contact with the various Compliance and Tax teams within the Company to address/discuss new regulations, reporting requirements and guidance/interpretation of rules
Vendor management for the various third-party tools and portals used for fund registrations and filings (Consensus, DITC, IRS portal, etc)
Oversee service providers who are responsible for FATCA and Common Reporting Standards filings
Calculate, support and assist in filing of Form 5500
Knowledge of regulatory and reporting standard across different jurisdictions (CIMA, CBI, AIFMD)
Fund specific filings including tax documents (W-9s, 8832s, SS-4s), GIIN registration and renewals, LEI applications, etc.
Work with Legal and Compliances teams to identify new funds in scope
Support accounting & administration platform of multiple master/feeder and umbrella structures.
Monitor / validate weekly & monthly NAV process for funds.
Reconcile settled cash and positions daily between our internal record keeping system and Prime Brokers/Custodians


What you will bring
Undergraduate degree required. (Accounting, Economics or Finance preferred).
5+ years prior experience in a Regulatory or similar type role required
Superior computer skills required.
VBA programming and database experience preferred.
Experience in supporting Hedge Funds and/or Offshore Fund Structures preferred
Knowledge of fixed income products and derivatives.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to organize, prioritize tasks and work in a deadline-oriented environment.
Self-motivated and proactive.
Strong interpersonal, communication and partnering skills.
Ability to drive process improvement.
Ability to collaborate with internal and external partners.


*Overtime may be required during peak periods. *

*PGIM welcomes all applicants, even if you don't meet every requirement. If your skills align with the role, we encourage you to apply.

Note: Prudential is required by state specific laws to include the salary range for this role when hiring a resident in applicable locations. The salary range for this role is from $110,000 to $125,000. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills.

About PGIM Fixed Income

PGIM Fixed Income is a global asset manager offering active solutions across all fixed income markets. With approximately 1000 employees and $859Bn assets under management, the company has offices in Newark, London, Letterkenny, Amsterdam, Munich, Zurich, Tokyo, Hong Kong, and Singapore. Our business climate is a safe inclusive environment, centered around mutual respect, intellectual honesty, transparency, and teamwork. Our leaders are focused on talent & culture; dedicated to fostering growth & development at all levels to develop the industry leaders of tomorrow.

What we offer you:

Market competitive base salaries, with a yearly bonus potential at every level.


Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, Paid Time Off (PTO), and leave of absences, such as parental and military leave.

401(k) plan with company match (up to 4%).


Company-funded pension plan.


Wellness Programsincluding up to $1,600 a year for reimbursement of items purchased to support personal wellbeing needs.

Work/Life Resources to help support topics such as parenting, housing, senior care, finances, pets, legal matters, education, emotional and mental health, and career development.

Education Benefit to help finance traditional college enrollment toward obtaining an approved degree and many accredited certificate programs.


Employee Stock Purchase Plan: Shares can be purchased at 85% of the lower of two prices (Beginning or End of the purchase period), after one year of service.


Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance. To find out more about our Total Rewards package, visit Work Life Balance | Prudential Careers. Some of the above benefits may not apply to part-time employees scheduled to work less than 20 hours per week.

Job Description:
We are seeking a talented and creative Digital Workspace Administrator to join our U.S. Financial Crimes Risk Management Communications team. This role will be instrumental in the design and implementation of a case management system using Microsoft Power Platform, and in the design and optimization of intranet sites (currently, SharePoint) for the U.S. FCRM Business office.
The Digital Workspace Administrator will ensure the intranet sites are functional, visually appealing, and remain consistently updated. They will also create a flagship, all-encompassing SharePoint site for the U.S. FCRM team.
The ideal candidate will possess a unique blend of technical acumen, design sensibility, and communication skills to ensure seamless collaboration and effective knowledge-sharing across the organization.
Key Responsibilities
Lead the design and implementation of a case management application using Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI).
Collaborate with the U.S. FCRM business office to gather requirements and set up intranet sites tailored to departmental needs.
Design, develop, and maintain intranet sites, ensuring user-friendly interfaces, sharp visuals, and optimal functionality.
Serve as the primary administrator for the flagship U.S. FCRM intranet site, ensuring it is an all-encompassing, error-free, and visually polished resource for employees.
Integrate case management workflows with SharePoint libraries, Power BI dashboards, task tracking tools, and other systems.
Collaborate with U.S. FCRM lines of business to regularly update and manage the storage of procedural and regulatory documents to ensure accuracy and consistence across all sites.
Monitor and resolve all technical issues so that sites operate smoothly and meet business needs.
Implement permissions and user access settings and maintain secure, appropriate access for all users.
Maintain consistent branding and design standards.
Provide guidance and training to employees on effective site use, enhancing adoption and productivity.
Ensure intranet sites align with broader communications strategies.
Assist with other Communications projects as needed, including design of documents and presentations.
Qualifications and Skills
Technical Expertise: Experience creating functional and visually appealing sites, including but not limited to proficiency in SharePoint design, development, and administration, customizing lists, the Microsoft Power Platform, JavaScript, and ASPX pages. Experience developing and continuously innovating by utilizing the latest features of low/no-code development tools within the Power Platform.
Design: Experience developing detailed design specifications, creating and reviewing code and assessing impact on other applications. Strong attention to detail and an eye for sharp, professional design and layout.
Communications: Ability to write clear, concise content and understand communications strategies to support team goals.
Problem Solving: Analytical, creative, and proactive in resolving technical challenges, delivering viable solutions, and improving site functionality.
Data Security Expertise: Ensure applications meet the highest standards for information security, data reliability, and ease of use. Design systems that support privacy and access to information rights within public service
Project Management: Experience leading technical aspects of a project from inception through deployment.Strong commitment to support and maintenance post-delivery while contributing to future enhancements.
Collaboration: Strong interpersonal skills to work effectively with stakeholders and across lines of business.
Knowledge of additional tools such as PowerApps and Microsoft 365 apps (Teams, OneDrive, etc.) and experience with workflows automation is preferred.
Familiarity with financial services, risk management, or regulatory environments is a plus.
Education and Experience
Bachelor's degree in computer science, communications, graphic design, or a related field.
3+ years of experience using Microsoft Power Platform
3+ years of experience in SharePoint design and administration.
Experience in a corporate communications environment or financial services sector is highly desirable.
#LI-AMCBCorporate
Who We Are:
TD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches/stores. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues.
TD is deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you've got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we're here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing - and so will you.
Our Total Rewards Package

Our Total Rewards package reflects the investments we make in our colleagues to help them and their families achieve their financial, physical and mental well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes base salary and variable compensation/incentive awards (e.g., eligibility for cash and/or equity incentive awards, generally through participation in an incentive plan) and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits, savings and retirement programs, paid time off (including Vacation PTO, Flex PTO, and Holiday PTO), banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition. Learn more
Additional Information:
We're delighted that you're considering building a career with TD. Through regular development conversations, training programs, and a competitive benefits plan, we're committed to providing the support our colleagues need to thrive both at work and at home.

Colleague Development
If you're interested in a specific career path or are looking to build certain skills, we want to help you succeed. You'll have regular career, development, and performance conversations with your manager, as well as access to an online learning platform and a variety of mentoring programs to help you unlock future opportunities. Whether you have a passion for helping customers and want to expand your experience, or you want to coach and inspire your colleagues, there are many different career paths within our organization at TD - and we're committed to helping you identify opportunities that support your goals.

Training & Onboarding
We will provide training and onboarding sessions to ensure that you've got everything you need to succeed in your new role.

Interview Process
We'll reach out to candidates of interest to schedule an interview. We do our best to communicate outcomes to all applicants by email or phone call.
Accommodation
If you are an applicant with a disability and need accommodations to complete the application process, email the TD Bank US Workplace Accommodations Program at USWAPTDO@td.com. Include your full name, best way to reach you, and the accommodation needed to assist you with the application process.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
Title: Digital Workspace Administrator

Description:
Job Summary
The Data Analytics Engineer is an energetic team player, passionate about analytics and continuous improvement. The ideal candidate is a motivated individual, possessing good analytical, critical thinking, communication, and interpersonal skills. Analyst will work closely with users in multiple business functions to transform business requirements into analytical solutions using a broad range of technologies that span across the analytics platform. Additionally, the Analyst will help support and advance strategic initiatives in the Analytics Center of Enablement.

Essential Duties
Provide analytical solutions through enterprise analytic platforms and meetings with the business to understand their analytics needs. This includes researching, designing, documenting, developing and modifying solutions throughout the production life cycle
Analyze data in Google Big Query through SQL, and provide recommendations on data products needed for Tableau.
Be accountable for the performance and results of the team within the deliverables assigned.
Maintain and enhance existing analytical solutions by making appropriate changes and validations to ensure that the desired results are produced
Assist with Tableau Server/Cloud administration, including monitoring environments, diagnosing problems, and repairing issues on time.
Design and implement Tableau Cloud data and workbook security model.
Curate and publish standardized data sources for Creators to access via Tableau Cloud.
Partner with the infrastructure team to troubleshoot and resolve network/server-related
Serve as backup Server Administrator to install and deploy new versions of Tableau software across all lifecycle environments.
Create/Modify/Manage Tableau Server Task Schedules.
Monitor Tableau Server activity/usage statistics to identify possible performance issues/enhancements. Proficiency with managing complex data from multiple data sources and demonstrate ability to understand new datasets and data structures.

Qualifications Required

Job Description:

We are seeking a talented and creative Digital Workspace Administrator to join our U.S. Financial Crimes Risk Management Communications team. This role will be instrumental in the design and implementation of a case management system using Microsoft Power Platform, and in the design and optimization of intranet sites (currently, SharePoint) for the U.S. FCRM Business office.

The Digital Workspace Administrator will ensure the intranet sites are functional, visually appealing, and remain consistently updated. They will also create a flagship, all-encompassing SharePoint site for the U.S. FCRM team.

The ideal candidate will possess a unique blend of technical acumen, design sensibility, and communication skills to ensure seamless collaboration and effective knowledge-sharing across the organization.

Key Responsibilities
Lead the design and implementation of a case management application using Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI).
Collaborate with the U.S. FCRM business office to gather requirements and set up intranet sites tailored to departmental needs.
Design, develop, and maintain intranet sites, ensuring user-friendly interfaces, sharp visuals, and optimal functionality.
Serve as the primary administrator for the flagship U.S. FCRM intranet site, ensuring it is an all-encompassing, error-free, and visually polished resource for employees.
Integrate case management workflows with SharePoint libraries, Power BI dashboards, task tracking tools, and other systems.
Collaborate with U.S. FCRM lines of business to regularly update and manage the storage of procedural and regulatory documents to ensure accuracy and consistence across all sites.
Monitor and resolve all technical issues so that sites operate smoothly and meet business needs.
Implement permissions and user access settings and maintain secure, appropriate access for all users.
Maintain consistent branding and design standards.
Provide guidance and training to employees on effective site use, enhancing adoption and productivity.
Ensure intranet sites align with broader communications strategies.
Assist with other Communications projects as needed, including design of documents and presentations.

Qualifications and Skills
Technical Expertise: Experience creating functional and visually appealing sites, including but not limited to proficiency in SharePoint design, development, and administration, customizing lists, the Microsoft Power Platform, JavaScript, and ASPX pages. Experience developing and continuously innovating by utilizing the latest features of low/no-code development tools within the Power Platform.
Design: Experience developing detailed design specifications, creating and reviewing code and assessing impact on other applications. Strong attention to detail and an eye for sharp, professional design and layout.
Communications: Ability to write clear, concise content and understand communications strategies to support team goals.
Problem Solving: Analytical, creative, and proactive in resolving technical challenges, delivering viable solutions, and improving site functionality.
Data Security Expertise: Ensure applications meet the highest standards for information security, data reliability, and ease of use. Design systems that support privacy and access to information rights within public service
Project Management: Experience leading technical aspects of a project from inception through deployment. Strong commitment to support and maintenance post-delivery while contributing to future enhancements.
Collaboration: Strong interpersonal skills to work effectively with stakeholders and across lines of business.
Knowledge of additional tools such as PowerApps and Microsoft 365 apps (Teams, OneDrive, etc.) and experience with workflows automation is preferred.
Familiarity with financial services, risk management, or regulatory environments is a plus.

Education and Experience
Bachelor's degree in computer science, communications, graphic design, or a related field.
3+ years of experience using Microsoft Power Platform
3+ years of experience in SharePoint design and administration.
Experience in a corporate communications environment or financial services sector is highly desirable.

Who We Are:
TD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches/stores. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues.

TD is deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you've got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we're here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing - and so will you.

Our Total Rewards Package

Our Total Rewards package reflects the investments we make in our colleagues to help them and their families achieve their financial, physical and mental well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes base salary and variable compensation/incentive awards (e.g., eligibility for cash and/or equity incentive awards, generally through participation in an incentive plan) and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits, savings and retirement programs, paid time off (including Vacation PTO, Flex PTO, and Holiday PTO), banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition. We're delighted that you're considering building a career with TD. Through regular development conversations, training programs, and a competitive benefits plan, we're committed to providing the support our colleagues need to thrive both at work and at home.

Colleague Development
If you're interested in a specific career path or are looking to build certain skills, we want to help you succeed. You'll have regular career, development, and performance conversations with your manager, as well as access to an online learning platform and a variety of mentoring programs to help you unlock future opportunities. Whether you have a passion for helping customers and want to expand your experience, or you want to coach and inspire your colleagues, there are many different career paths within our organization at TD - and we're committed to helping you identify opportunities that support your goals.

Training & Onboarding
We will provide training and onboarding sessions to ensure that you've got everything you need to succeed in your new role.

Interview Process
We'll reach out to candidates of interest to schedule an interview. We do our best to communicate outcomes to all applicants by email or phone call.

Accommodation

Position Overview: The Transportation Security Administration (TSA) is seeking qualified candidates to fill roles within its security operations: Role Player Personnel. The selected contractor personnel will be responsible for supporting TSA's mission by ensuring the security of transportation systems and contributing to a safe travel environment.
Role Player Personnel: Participate in training exercises by role-playing various scenarios to aid in TSA security training. Follow instructions carefully and perform physical roles accurately to simulate real-life situations for TSA personnel training.
Locations: College Park, GA; Coppell, TX; San Antonio, TX; Atlantic City, NJ;
Minimum Requirements for All Contractor Personnel:
Age: Must be at least 18 years of age.
US Citizen
Driving License: Must possess or be able to obtain a valid driver's license by the time of hire.
Substance Abuse: Must have no record or conviction of drug or alcohol abuse.
Criminal Record: Must have no criminal record, except for minor traffic offenses. Note that minor traffic offenses do not include driving under the influence. Additionally, there should be no conviction of a felony, misdemeanor, or domestic violence.
Language Proficiency: Must be able to speak, read, and write English at a high school level.
Security Clearance: Must receive a favorable "eligibility of determination" suitability check through the TSA Office of Personnel Security (PerSec).
Compliance: Adhere to any other hiring requirements established by the contractor.
Additional Responsibilities:
Change in Status Notification: The contractor must notify the Contracting Officer (CO) and Contracting Officer's Representative (COR) immediately (within 24 hours) if any employee's status changes with respect to the requirements listed above. The Role Play is responsible for communicating these changes to the employer within 24 hours of the change.
Background Screening: The Role Player must be willing to undergo screening for potential felony or misdemeanor convictions or any other criminal records.

Must be able to work in various environments related to transportation security operations. (environmental conditions)
Must be willing to undergo thorough background checks and security screenings.
Good physical conditioning and stamina required
Able to perform required physical actions, including but not limited to the following:
Walking and standing for an extended period of time, sprinting/running, lifting and carrying objects with varying weight, stopping and bending, squatting, reaching, put on knees on the ground, handcuffed, etc.
Able to perform weapons handling related tasks, including firing blanks firing weapons
Able to be handcuffed and searched, as scenario dictates

Able to withstand hot/cold weather

Description:
Who We Are
Johns Manville is a leading manufacturer and marketer of premium-quality insulation and commercial roofing, along with glass fibers and nonwovens for commercial, industrial and residential applications. Our products are used in a wide variety of industries including building products, aerospace, automotive and transportation, filtration, commercial interiors, waterproofing and wind energy.
A proud member of the Berkshire Hathaway family of companies, we serve customers in more than 80 countries around the globe. We are committed to delivering positive and powerful experiences, because we are successful only when our employees and customers thrive. We are passionate, we care about people, we perform at a superior level, and we protect others and our environments.
Pay Range
$86,600.00-$119,100.00 Annual
This is the base salary pay range that an applicant can expect to make upon hire. Pay within this range will vary based upon relevant experience, skills, and education among other factors. In addition, this position is eligible for an incentive bonus.
Position Overview:
The Facility Occupational Health Nurse would provide on-site access to immediate care for any injury that would occur on site. The position would also be responsible for performing all regulatory requirements for Hearing Tests, Respirator Fit Testing and other required testing for employees as well as other related activities related to an Industrial Nurse.
Your Day to Day:
Perform daily case management of all work-related incidents
Perform weekly hearing tests and establish follow up exams with Audiologist
Perform weekly respirator fit tests and associated training
Perform weekly pulmonary functions test
Build tracking database for all testing requirements
Hold monthly CPR classes and review HEP B program
Check all AED's monthly
Calibrate equipment on a monthly basis
Administer annual flu shots
Set up quarterly blood drives
Attend weekly safety meetings
Order supplies and restock on a weekly basis
Perform blood pressure checks on daily/weekly basis
Perform First Aid outside of medical treatment
May be required to perform other related duties as assigned
What You Bring to the Team:
Associate of Science in Nursing (ASN) required, Bachelor of Science degree in Nursing (BNS) and 2 years of Occupational Health experience
Manufacturing/Industrial environment experience is preferred
Demonstrated ability to perform blood pressure checks, pulmonary function testing and respiratory fit testing
Demonstrated ability to perform respiratory testing, PAPR testing, audiograms/education/training, and CPR training
Fundamental knowledge of OSHA regulations
Demonstrated ability to calibrate audiometric equipment
Working knowledge of workers compensation guidelines and case management
Demonstrated ability to perform testing on EARfit system, drug screens (urine, cheek swab, etc.) and administer flu shots
Basic ability to order supplies and file paperwork, etc.
Ability to work independently and with all levels of the organization, both internally and externally
Minimal travel required (0 - 10 days per year)
Availability to be on-call 24/7
Work environment is typical of an office setting in a manufacturing facility; may be exposed from time to time to environmental conditions of cold, heat, high noise levels, moving mechanical parts, heights, dust/mist/gas/fumes, extensive walking or climbing, etc.
May be required to lift, carry, push or pull up to and including 25 pounds
Please Keep in Mind
If you do not meet 100% of these requirements, we at JM still want to hear from you. So, if you are interested in the role, we encourage you to apply so we can learn how your skills and talents can contribute to our team.
Benefits
Johns Manville (JM) offers a wide range of benefits to employees. Some are subsidized by the company and others are fully employee-paid. Health benefits include a choice of comprehensive medical plans, a dental plan, vision plan, wellness program and critical illness insurance. JM sponsors a 401(k) plan which includes a sizeable company match. JM offers paid vacation and also provides paid sick and parental leave for eligible employees.
Additionally, Johns Manville provides basic life Insurance, short-term and long-term disability coverage, an employee assistance program, and business travel accident coverage. Supplemental life insurance and accidental death and dismemberment insurance are available as well. The company also offers a variety of tax saving accounts; health spending account, traditional flexible spending account, and a dependent care spending account. JM also offers a tuition reimbursement program for undergraduate and certain graduate programs.
Diversity & Inclusion
Johns Manville believes diversity and inclusion in our workplace is critical for the long-term success of our company. We are committed to retaining, developing and attracting a diverse workforce that fosters an inclusive work environment in which all employees are treated with dignity and respect. This is the right thing to do for our employees, our company and our communities. Our D&I council is composed of employees from locations across North American & Europe who meet regularly and work to promote and foster an environment of inclusion. Born from our D&I council is our network of employee resource groups (ERGs) that are focused on supporting diverse communities in the workplace. Review more about our diversity & inclusion initiatives on JM's Career page.
Incumbent must be physically able to perform essential job functions. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.
We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

Description:
Since 1869 we've connected people through food they love. We're proud to be stewards of amazing brands that people trust. Our portfolio includes the iconic Campbell's brand, as well as Michael Angelo's, noosa, Pace, Pacific Foods, Prego, Rao's Homemade, Swanson, and V8. In our Snacks division, we have brands like Cape Cod, Goldfish, Kettle Brand, Lance, Late July, Pepperidge Farm, Snack Factory, and Snyder's of Hanover.
Here, you will make a difference every day. You will be supported to build a rewarding career with opportunities to grow, innovate and inspire. Make history with us.
Why Campbell's...
Benefits begin on day one and include medical, dental, short and long-term disability, AD&D, and life insurance (for individual, families, and domestic partners).
Employees are eligible for our matching 401(k) plan and can enroll on the first day of employment with immediate vesting.
Campbell's offers unlimited sick time along with paid time off and holiday pay.
If in WHQ - free access to the fitness center. Access to on-site day care (operated by Bright Horizons) and company store.
Giving back to the communities where our employees work and live is very important to Campbell's. Our "Campbell's Cares" program matches employee donations and/or volunteer activity up to $1,500 annually.
Campbell's has a variety of Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to support employees.
How you will make history here...
Opportunity to work in a high visibility role which has a direct impact to the entire organization. This is an excellent role for career development within investor relations.
What you will do...
The Senior Analyst, Investor Relations role supports the Investor Relations team in the areas of research, presentation, and analysis. The position resides within a fast-paced team and environment where core finance skills, clear communication, multi-tasking, and extreme attention to detail, are critical to success.
Additionally, this role will provide some administrative support to the department including managing workplans and calendars, expense and budget reporting and other admin support and tasks, including supporting marketing efforts for equity analysts and other stakeholders.
This role provides an excellent opportunity to learn our business from the inside out and will provide tremendous 'on-the-job training' as you work closely with members of Investor Relations team and other members throughout the broader finance organization as well as the business units.
Principal Responsibilities
Investor Relations Support
Contribute to all aspects of Campbell's investor relations strategies, objectives, and key results, to ensure clear, consistent and accurate communication with the investment community
Assist in preparation and manage investor communications, including earnings releases, conference call scripts, investor presentations, shareholder letters, marketing decks, analytical and support documents and Q&A documents.
Monitor and analyze shareholder base and market trends, providing insights to senior leadership.
Support planning and execution of investor events, including roadshows, investor conferences, and annual shareholder meetings.
Maintain corporate Investor Relations website, working closely with vendor(s)
Maintain analyst consensus models, working closely with vendor(s) on a timely basis
Event management - including managing quarterly earnings call logistics as well as assisting in planning and executing events such as non-deal roadshows, HQ visits, and Investor Days.
Attend earnings prep materials, as well as buy-side/sell-side calls or meetings as requested for the purpose of capturing thorough notes, logging in IR CRM and managing follow ups.
Assist on other ad hoc admin or strategy projects
Act as central point of contact for Vendor / PO management and IR budgeting process
Managing / updating the peer slides included in Board of Directors materials
Financial Analysis and Reporting
Analyze business data sets or financial statements.
Assist in modeling and forecasting to provide inputs for investor-related materials.
Analyze and track analyst research, earnings estimates, and financial models, providing insights on potential impacts.
Stakeholder Engagement:
Manage interactions with analysts and investors by addressing inquiries and coordinating meetings.
Collaborate with internal teams, including Finance, Legal, and Communications, to ensure alignment in messaging and disclosures.
Maintain and update investor databases and reporting tools, ensuring accuracy and compliance.
Market Intelligence:
Monitor and report on industry trends, competitor performance, and macroeconomic factors impacting the company. May include key suppliers, retailers, and companies in adjacent industries.
Support compiling and preparing detailed company analyses for dissemination and reporting to senior management team, including summaries of relevant quarterly earnings reports.
Provide regular updates to senior management on investor sentiment and perceptions.
Track peer companies' activities to benchmark performance and communication strategies.
Who you will work with...
Executive leadership and key stakeholders across the organization
External vendor partners
What you bring to the table...(Must Have)
3+ years of experience in a public company FP&A or external reporting role
Bachelor's degree required in business, finance, economicsor related field; MBA or CFA designation is a plus
Strong understanding of financial statements, market dynamics, and valuation metrics.
Highly proficient in Microsoft Suite (Outlook, PowerPoint, Word, Excel); Think Cell a plus
It would be great if you have...(Nice to Have)
Prior Investor Relations within a public company, or equity research / investment banking experience strong plus
Highly organized and disciplined with great attention to detail
Excellent written, communication, prioritization and project management skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with key stakeholders
Analytical, strong quantitative problem-solving skills; Detail oriented, highly organized individual
Ability to communicate and work in a collaborative team environment, meet deadlines, work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects.
Proactive /problem-solving mindset; Self-starter, self-motivated and resourceful.
Proven ability to work under pressure, handle confidential information with discretion, be adaptable to various competing demands, and demonstrate the highest level of customer/client service and response
Impeccable integrity and respect for confidentially of material.
Committed to maintaining strong team work ethic and environment.
Compensation and Benefits:
The target base salary range for this full-time, salaried position is between
$84,700-$121,800
Individual base pay depends on work location and additional factors such as experience, job-related skills, and relevant education or training. Total pay may include other forms of compensation. In addition, we offer competitive health, dental, 401k and wellness benefits beginning on the first day of employment. Please ask your Talent Acquisition Partner for more information about our total rewards package.
The Company is committed to providing equal opportunity for employees and qualified applicants in all aspects of the employment relationship, including consideration for employment, without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, marital status, protected veteran status, disability, age, religion, or any other classification protected by law.

  Bradford Airport Logistics is seeking a Warehouse Operations Supervisor (OS) to provide team member supervision, decision-making, and excellent customer service at our offsite warehouse that serves Newark Liberty International Airport. The successful candidate will manage operations at our receiving and redistribution dock and supplier and customer relationships. A strong work ethic, initiative, and drive to build and maintain a world-class team are a must. For qualified candidates, we offer significant opportunities for career growth that may include promotion and relocation opportunities.
  Airport Operations Supervisor Required Qualifications:

Logistics/airline/airport/warehouse or related industry experience preferred.
High integrity and trustworthiness.

Strong work ethic.
Excellent written and oral presentation skills.
Accurate and detail-oriented.
Experience executing action plans to hit short and long-term targets.

Word processing, e-mail, database, and Internet software.

Employer-paid health insurance
Annual bonus
Paid holidays
401K Company match
Professional Development Program
Opportunities for Career Advancement
On-site free parking
  Airport Operations Supervisor Duties Include:
Train and ensure employees comply with all procedures and regulations for BAL, the airport, TSA, customers, and other stakeholders
Ensure the operations team is professional, motivated, and customer-focused in accordance with BAL's Core Values and Mission, Vision, and Purpose Statements
Provide hands-on leadership in an active, physically demanding environment

Open and/or close the operation daily

Provide suggestions to improve the performance, safety, and efficiency of the operation
